responses.rationale: Describes a future possibility ('going to be around next year') without active reassurance.
Describes an emotional state ('very heartbreaking') not capability/preparedness.
Describes suggested steps/measures ('take steps to protect', 'stressing testing and biosecurity measures') without active reassurance.
Describes an action taken ('canceled two attractions') as a safeguard without active reassurance.
Describes an action taken ('excluded birthing cows and newborn calves') as a precaution without active reassurance.
Describes a requirement ('only if they have proof of negative flu tests') as a safeguard without active reassurance.
Describes actions taken ('made changes to try to lessen the chances') as safeguards without active reassurance.
Describes restrictions and cancellations ('restrictions didn't outright ban', 'opted to cancel') as safeguards without active reassurance.
Describes a requirement ('must test negative') as a safeguard without active reassurance.
Describes ordered measures ('ordered strict testing and public health measures', 'banning the exhibition') without active reassurance.
Describes impact ('hardest-hit states', 'infected', 'affected') not capability/preparedness.
Personal statement about impact ('can't show') not capability/preparedness.
Personal statement about impact ('haven't been able to show') not capability/preparedness.
Describes impact ('has disrupted') not capability/preparedness.
Describes impact ('laid off') not capability/preparedness.
Describes impact ('strained businesses', 'losses', 'layoffs') not capability/preparedness.
Contains explicit calming language ('risk to humans from the bird flu virus remains low').
Describes impact ('infected', 'experiencing relatively mild symptoms') not capability/preparedness.
Describes actions taken ('tightened restrictions') as safeguards without active reassurance.
Describes impact ('forced significant changes or outright cancellations') not capability/preparedness being implemented.
Describes impact ('interfered') not capability/preparedness.
Call to action for preparedness ('Order the Wellness Company’s Contagion Kit') without active reassurance.
Call to action for preparedness ('Don’t be caught unprepared') without active reassurance.
Describes a positive experience with a preparedness item ('thankful to have it') without active reassurance.
Contains explicit calming language ('amazing peace of mind').
Call to action for preparedness ('encourage everyone to buy one of these for emergencies') without active reassurance.
Contains explicit calming language ('for peace of mind').
Describes a process for obtaining a preparedness item ('fill out a short questionnaire') without active reassurance.
Call to action for protection/preparedness ('Protect yourself and your family') without active reassurance.
Call to action for preparedness ('Never be caught without these critical drugs') without active reassurance.
Contains explicit calming language ('keeping you safe and healthy').
Describes having tools available ('we have the tools available to defend our health') without active reassurance.
Contains explicit calming language ('not the time to panic', 'time to be prepared').
Describes a medication's function ('disrupts the replication', 'reduce the severity') as a capability/treatment without active reassurance.
Describes an action taken ('adding Tamiflu') as a preparedness measure ('abundance of caution') without active reassurance.
Describes an action taken ('added Tamiflu') as a preparedness measure ('Emergency Kit') without active reassurance.
Describes potential future risk/impact ('real worry', 'mortality rate').
Describes a characteristic of the virus ('is mutating') not capability/preparedness.
Describes an action taken ('issued a stark warning') not capability/preparedness.
Contains explicit calming language ('effects to human health are minimal').
Describes impact ('birds have been killed') not capability/preparedness.
Describes impact ('most birds killed') not capability/preparedness.
Describes a finding ('case was found') not capability/preparedness.
Describes spread ('affecting Canada', 'has been found') not capability/preparedness.
Describes detection ('has also been detected') not capability/preparedness.
Describes an ongoing effort ('trying to catch all the reports') as surveillance/response without active reassurance.
Describes impact ('continued to increase', 'really busy season') not capability/preparedness.
Describes impact ('continued to increase') not capability/preparedness.
Describes an action taken ('reported responding to dozens of seal strandings') as a response measure without active reassurance.
Describes an ongoing effort ('working with local, state, tribal, federal and international groups') as a response measure without active reassurance.
Contains explicit calming language ('It rarely affects humans').
Describes location of events ('happened in the southern and central coast') not capability/preparedness.
Provides public health advice/guidance ('ask the public not to touch', 'keep pets far away', 'call their local stranding network organization') as a safeguard without active reassurance.
Contains explicit calming language ('The risk to the public from the occurrence of avian flu in seals is low').
Describes a confirmation/finding ('samples from four stranded seals tested positive') not capability/preparedness.
Describes an action taken ('gave the 'unusual' designation') which authorizes a response ('authorizes a federal investigation') without active reassurance.
Describes an action taken ('gave the 'unusual' designation') which implies activating a response mechanism without active reassurance.
Describes a fact/finding ('Most of the seals were found dead') not capability/preparedness.
Describes events/numbers ('strandings began', '159 have been reported') not capability/preparedness.
Describes a designation ('deemed an 'unusual mortality event'') sparking a response ('sparking a federal investigation') without active reassurance.

Describes the importance of detection and minimizing transmission ('important to detect human cases', 'make sure that we give as little opportunity') relating to response/safeguards without active reassurance.
Describes a historical process ('adapted and became endemic') not capability/preparedness.
Describes a historical event/impact ('Spanish flu pandemic of 1918, which killed an estimated 50 million people') not capability/preparedness.
Contains explicit calming language ('The risk to humans is still very low').
Describes a characteristic of the virus and potential future risk ('could increase the possibility of further human infections') not capability/preparedness.
Describes specific cases/findings ('four cases in otters, four in seals and one in a fox') not capability/preparedness.
Describes specific findings ('14 out of 134 wild mammals collected... were found to have avian flu') not capability/preparedness.
Describes findings/numbers ('confirmed it had found avian flu cases', 'a rise of 15 new premises and 209 detections') not capability/preparedness.
Contains explicit calming language ('direct risks of infection were low').
Describes a fact ('have not resulted in human-to-human transmission') and a requirement ('vigilance is required') implying preparedness without active reassurance.
Describes historical impact/numbers ('over 850 cases in humans', 'high case-fatality rate') not capability/preparedness.
Describes a state of readiness ('we remain vigilant') as a preparedness statement without active reassurance.
Describes a state of readiness ('we remain vigilant') as a preparedness statement without active reassurance.
Contains explicit calming language ('does not pass easily to people').
Describes an ongoing investigation ('Investigators are now trying to establish') as a response/capability without active reassurance.
Contains explicit calming language ('human-to-human transmission is rare').
Describes emotional impact and scale of deaths ('so sad', 'dying in such large numbers') not capability/preparedness.
Describes findings/numbers ('found 246 dead birds', 'found 107') not capability/preparedness.
Describes actions taken ('monitoring the Bijol Islands', 'digging holes in the sand to bury dead birds') as response measures without active reassurance.

Describes the nature of the situation ('management of a global pandemic') and a recommendation for assistance ('should at least be offering assistance') relating to capability without active reassurance.
Describes a request for funding for surveillance and disposal ('ask the UK government to help fund the surveillance and disposal') as enabling capability without active reassurance.
Describes the need for resources and staff ('having staff on the ground with the resources that enable them to act is essential') as capability/preparedness without active reassurance.
States the importance of a response characteristic ('Rapid reaction is critical') implying needed capability/preparedness without active reassurance.
Describes government priorities not capability/preparedness measures themselves.
Describes funding sources not capability/preparedness measures themselves.
Describes a limitation ('have limited conservation funds') not capability/preparedness measures themselves.
Compares cost of spread vs surveillance/control, not stating capability exists or is sufficient.
Describes a threat ('outbreaks threaten birds and poultry') and observed impact ('saw more than 500 dead seabirds') not capability/preparedness.
Describes a confirmation/finding ('confirmed the H5N1 outbreak') not capability/preparedness.
Describes actions taken ('have buried hundreds of dead birds') as response measures without active reassurance.

Describes a potential future impact ('could affect vast numbers') and a condition for mitigation ('unless international funding is secured') relating to enabling capability without active reassurance.

Describes findings ('Hundreds of dead birds found') and a call for funding ('call for international funding to help stop the disease spreading') relating to capability/response without active reassurance.
Describes an ongoing action ('responding to their requests', 'provide information') as a response/capability without active reassurance.
Describes a request for information not capability/preparedness being stated by the source.
Expresses an opinion ('don't feel') and describes impact ('big deal') not capability/preparedness.
Describes an action taken by another country ('imposed restrictions') not capability/preparedness of the subject.
Describes a case/finding ('person exposed to cattle tested positive') not capability/preparedness.
Describes a potential consequence of restrictions not capability/preparedness.
Describes an action taken by another country ('imposed temporary restrictions') not capability/preparedness of the subject.
Describes a ban ('the ban includes beef products') as a measure/safeguard without active reassurance.
Provides context about trade volume not capability/preparedness.
Describes an action taken by another country ('limit trade') and its impact not capability/preparedness of the subject.
Describes an action taken by another country ('has restricted the import') not capability/preparedness of the subject.
Describes context and market facts not capability/preparedness.
Describes impact ('experiencing some tightening of supply') not capability/preparedness.
Describes potential future impacts ('could ultimately see higher prices', 'could experience 'reputational strain'') not capability/preparedness.
Describes a concern about potential impact not capability/preparedness.
Describes a lack of protection/capability ('don’t have a magic forcefield').
Describes potential impact and concerns not capability/preparedness.
Describes how spread occurred not capability/preparedness.
Describes historical instances of spread not capability/preparedness.
Describes a state of readiness ('scientists are on guard') as preparedness without active reassurance.
Describes symptoms not capability/preparedness.
Describes symptoms not capability/preparedness.
Describes symptoms and outcome not capability/preparedness.
Describes number of cases and outcome not capability/preparedness.
Describes historical impact/numbers not capability/preparedness.
Describes historical event not capability/preparedness.
Describes findings/locations not capability/preparedness.
Describes impact (deaths, culling) focusing on scale, not capability itself.
Describes detection/spread not capability/preparedness.
Describes spread not capability/preparedness.
Describes a characteristic of the virus (evolution) not capability/preparedness.
Contains statements of capability/preparedness ('we’ve been studying it', 'we’ve been preparing for avian flu for 20 years') without active reassurance.
Contains explicit calming language ('The good news is').
Contains statements implying response/preparedness ('agency is taking bird flu seriously', 'virus has already been well studied') without explicit calming keywords.
Describes developments/findings not capability/preparedness.
Describes events/findings ('reported outbreaks') not capability/preparedness.
Describes developments and concerns not capability/preparedness.
States a goal/instruction ('Protect health and welfare') not a specific capability/preparedness measure being taken or existing.
Describes an action taken ('France has been trialling bird flu vaccines') as a response/capability measure without active reassurance.
Describes impact ('rampant', 'suffering one of its worst winters') not capability/preparedness.
Describes a rule/consequence not a capability/preparedness measure to control the disease.
Describes a future possibility ('birds will be able to go outside again') contingent on measures being lifted, relating to response without active reassurance.
Describes a consequence of measures (labeling) and the reason ('to protect their health and welfare') as a safeguard without active reassurance.
Describes actions taken ('supermarkets will put up signs') and a future possibility ('eggs will go back to being free-range') relating to response without active reassurance.
Describes a rule/consequence being enforced not a capability/preparedness measure to control the disease.
Describes a measure taken ('in bird flu lockdown') as a safeguard without active reassurance.
Describes a consequence ('disappear') and the reason (housing measures) not a capability/preparedness measure to control the disease.
Describes a measure ('sanitary radius') and a future action ('authorities would decide on possible culling') as response measures/capabilities without active reassurance.
Describes spread/findings ('cases have also appeared') not capability/preparedness.
Describes a case/finding ('infection... was the country's second case') not capability/preparedness.
Describes a planned action ('will cull nearly 140,000 turkey and chickens') as a response measure/capability without active reassurance.
Describes a state ('poultry industry is on alert') as preparedness without active reassurance.
Describes reporting/confirmation and impact (culling) focusing on scale, not capability itself.
Describes historical impact (culling) not capability/preparedness.
Describes historical impact (culling) not capability/preparedness.
Provides context (population size) not capability/preparedness.
Describes impact (culling) not capability/preparedness.
Describes planned actions ('will be slaughtered and buried', 'will be restricted') as response measures/capabilities without active reassurance.
Describes the start and scale of an outbreak not capability/preparedness.
Contains explicit calming language ('Humans cannot contract bird flu from eating poultry or eggs').
Describes a finding/detection ('Avian influenza was discovered') not capability/preparedness.
Describes detection and scale of outbreak ('Bird flu has been detected', 'sparks Japan's worst outbreak') not capability/preparedness.
Describes a future possibility/goal ('aim for some incredible game-changing interventions') without active reassurance.
Expresses a personal feeling not capability/preparedness.
Expresses uncertainty and a prediction about a future outcome not capability/preparedness.
Expresses hope for future progress ('Hopefully we’ll make some inroads') without active reassurance.
Expresses a personal feeling not capability/preparedness.
Describes a potential future outcome/possibility ('could create a path for serious control') without active reassurance.
Describes a past action/achievement not capability/preparedness for the current threat.
Expresses a hope for future realization of interventions ('love to see the promise of the malaria interventions realized') as capabilities without active reassurance.
A question about metrics not capability/preparedness.
Describes a plan/goal ('want a living document', 'will have individual pages') supporting capability/preparedness without active reassurance.
Describes a past event about a strategic vision not a current capability/preparedness measure.
Describes the effectiveness/efficacy of PrEP ('we have effective PrEP', 'biomedically effective') as a capability/treatment without active reassurance.
Describes the effectiveness/efficacy of PrEP ('we have effective PrEP') as a capability/treatment without active reassurance.
Contains explicit calming language ('could have safe sex').
Describes a behavior/fact about uptake not capability/preparedness.
